title: Russia Targets Kyiv Region As Moscow Says 4 Killed In Attacks On Sevastopol , Belgorod
message:
Russia Targets Kyiv Region As Moscow Says 4 Killed In Attacks On Sevastopol, BelgorodBy RFE/RL's Ukrainian Service June 23, 2024Russia launched three missiles targeting Kyiv region in an early morning strike on June 23 after at least two civilians were killed when a residential building was struck by a Russian bomb in the northeastern city of Kharkiv a day earlier.
Ukraine's Air Force said that two of the three missiles fired at the Kyiv region on June 23 were downed.
In Russia's southwestern Belgorod region, which borders Ukraine, one person was killed and three were injured by Ukrainian drones, said regional Governor Vyacheslav Gladkov.
Russia's attacks on Kyiv and Kharkiv earlier on June 23 came a day after Russia launched a large-scale missile and drone attack on Ukraine's battered energy infrastructure.
The State Emergency Service on June 23 issued revised the figures downward to two killed and 53 injured, including three children.
event_breakdown:
Russia Launches Missiles at Kyiv Region, Belgorod
Russia launched three missiles targeting the Kyiv region and fired missiles at Kharkiv, killing at least two civilians. Russia also attacked Kyiv and Kharkiv one day after Ukraine's energy infrastructure was battered by Russian missiles and drones. One person was killed in the attack and three were injured.

title: US Responsible for Sevastopol Strike With Weapons Supplied to Ukraine
message:
US Responsible for Sevastopol Strike With Weapons Supplied to Ukraine - Russian MoDSputnik News20240623Washington is responsible for the missile strike on Sevastopol's civilians, as all targeting data for the ATACMS missiles used are entered by US specialists, the Russian Ministry of Defense said.
Flight missions for ATACMS missiles are programmed by American specialists based on US satellite reconnaissance, making Washington primarily responsible for the deliberate missile strike on Sevastopol's civilians, the Russian Ministry of Defense (MoD) stated.
"Therefore, the responsibility for the deliberate missile strike on Sevastopol's civilians lies primarily with Washington, which supplied this weapon to Ukraine, as well as the Kiev regime, from whose territory the strike was launched," the statement said.
According to the Russian Ministry of Health, 124 people were injured, including 27 children, and three people were killed, including two children.
The strike on Sevastopol's civilians with US ATACMS missiles will not go unanswered, the Russian MoD said.
event_breakdown: US Responsible for Sevastopol Strike With Weapons Supplied to Ukraine

title: Hezbollah drone strike hits Israeli military base , leaves casualties
message:
Hezbollah drone strike hits Israeli military base, leaves casualtiesIran Press TVSunday, 23 June 2024 8:10 AMLebanon's Hezbollah resistance movement has conducted a drone strike on an Israeli military base, leaving casualties among the occupation forces.
It added that the raid had killed and wounded an unspecified number of Israeli officers and soldiers.
Hezbollah also emphasized that the strike came in support of the Palestinian people in the Gaza Strip and their resistance, as well as in response to an Israeli assassination operation in Lebanon.
On Saturday, an Israeli drone strike targeted a car in the town of Khiara in the Western Bekaa area and killed its driver, who was later identified as Ayman Hashem Ghattma, a leader of the Islamic Group political party in Lebanon.
In a statement, the Islamic Group called the targeted killing "a new crime" committed by the Zionist regime against the Lebanese and Palestinian people.

title: Israel  intense  operations in Gaza  about to end  with attention to move to Hezbollah : Netanyahu
message:
Israel’s “intense” phase of war with Hamas in Gaza is “about to end,” Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu said on Sunday, signaling that the Jewish state’s attention will likely turn to the country’s north amid threats from Hezbollah.
“The intense phase of the fighting against Hamas is about to end,” Netanyahu told Channel 14, an Israeli television station.
“It doesn’t mean that the war is about to end, but the war in its intense phase is about to end in Rafah.
After the end of the intense phase, we will be able to redeploy some forces to the north, and we will do that.
The level of threats between Israel and Hezbollah intensified following last week’s killing by Israel of Hezbollah’s most senior commander.

message:
Russia accuses Ukraine of deadly drone attacks in Crimea's SevastopolWorld World Russia accuses Ukraine of deadly drone attacks in Crimea's SevastopolRussia said four people died and over 100 were wounded in Ukrainian drone and missile attacksFollow on Published On: Mon, 24 Jun 2024 08:00:03 PKTMOSCOW (AP) - Russian authorities said four people died and over 100 were wounded in Ukrainian drone and missile attacks on Sunday, while the second day of Russia's aerial bombing of Kharkiv in northeastern Ukraine killed at least one person.

title: US directly involved in deadly attack on Crimea , says Russia - World
message:
MOSCOW: Russia said on Sunday that the United States was “directly responsible” for an attack carried out from Ukra­inian territory with five missiles that killed at least five people, including three children, and injured 124 more in Crimea.
The Russian defence ministry said US specialists had set the missiles’ flight coordinates on the basis of information from US spy satellites, meaning Washington was directly responsible.
The ministry said four missiles were downed but a fifth changed trajectory after being intercepted “with its warhead exploding in the air over the city”.
Russian-installed auth­o­rities in Crimea said missile fragments had fallen just after noon near a beach on the north side of Sevastopol city where locals were holidaying.
At least 124 were inju­red, Russian Health Mini­ster Mikhail Mura­shko said.

title: Missile Attack Confirmed in Arabian Sea
message:
DUBAI, June 24 (Reuters) – A merchant vessel in the Arabian Sea reported an explosion in close proximity to it on Monday, the United Kingdom Maritime Trade Operations (UKMTO) said.
UKMTO said the crew was reported safe and the vessel was proceeding to its next port of call.
The Red Sea and Gulf of Aden Joint Maritime Information Center (JMIC) later identified the vessel as Liberian-flagged container MSC SARAH V, saying it was attacked by a missile while navigating the Arabian Sea but was not hit.
The ship reported a missile landing in the water approximately 50 meters off the starboard side of the ship, JMIC said.
A map showing the approximately location of the missile attack on the MSC Sarah V. Map courtesy Joint Maritime Information CenterYemen’s Iran-aligned Houthi group has been launching drone and missile strikes in shipping lanes since November, saying that it acts in solidarity with Palestinians in Israel’s war in Gaza.
event_breakdown: Map: The missile strike on Monday hit a Liberian-flagged container vessel as it was navigating the Arabian Sea off the coast of Yemen.

title: Russia points finger at US for deadly Ukrainian attack on Crimea
message:
Russian authorities say the U.S. is responsible for a deadly Ukrainian attack on the Crimean Peninsula on Sunday.
The Russian Defense Ministry said four Army Tactical Missile System (ATACMS) missiles, which the U.S. supplied to Ukraine, were equipped with cluster warheads.
The missiles were shot down by air defense systems, the ministry said, while a fifth missile was detonated midair.
RUSSIA ‘OPEN TO DIALOGUE’ WITH US: KREMLINMikhail Razvozhayev, the Moscow-installed governor of the city of Sevastopol, said 151 people were wounded in the incident.
Earlier this year, the U.S. started supplying Ukraine with ATACMS missiles, giving the country the ability to strike targets within a 186-mile range.
event_breakdown: Russian authorities say the U.S. is responsible for a deadly Ukrainian attack on the Crimean Peninsula on Sunday. The U.S. started supplying Ukraine with Army Tactical Missile System (ATACMS) missiles earlier this year.

title: Russia says US is responsible for deadly Ukrainian attack on Crimea
message:
Russia said on Sunday that the United States was responsible for a Ukrainian attack on the Russian-annexed Crimean Peninsula with five U.S.-supplied missiles that killed four people, including two children, and injured 151 more.
Footage on Russian state television showed people running from a beach and some people being carried off on sun loungers.
The Defense Ministry said U.S. specialists had set the missiles' flight coordinates on the basis of information from U.S. spy satellites, meaning Washington was directly responsible.
The United States began supplying Ukraine with longer range ATACMS missiles, which have a 300-kilometer (186-mile) range, earlier this year.
Russia will respond to Sunday's attack, the Defense Ministry said, without elaborating.
event_breakdown: U.S. missile attack on Russian-annexed Crimea kills 4, wounds 151

title: Suspect convicted of mistaken - ID murder of Amsterdam DJ Djordy Latumahina
message:
Noureddine H. was convicted on Monday in the 2016 mistaken identity shooting that killed Amsterdam DJ Djordy Latumahina and injured his girlfriend.
The District Court of Amsterdam sentenced the 43-year-old to 25.5 years in prison, four fewer than the Public Prosecution Service (OM) recommended.
The court ruled that H. orchestrated the Amsterdam-West shooting eight years ago on October 8.
At the time of the violence, Latumahina was sitting in his car with his girlfriend and their 2-year-old daughter in a parking garage on Koningin Wilhelminaplein.
The intended target was another individual, Gino M.According to the court, revenge is the motive for the deadly violence.

Target event: Shooting in Amsterdam-West
Current event: Noureddine H. was convicted in the District Court of Amsterdam for the 2016 mistaken identity shooting that killed Amsterdam DJ Djordy Latumahina and injured his girlfriend. He was sentenced to 25.5 years in prison.

title: Eisenhower Aircraft Carrier Group Heads Home After Months Battling Houthis in Red Sea
message:
The Houthis, designated a terrorist organization by the United States, have harassed the Red Sea shipping lane for months with missiles and explosive-laden drones.
The Eisenhower Carrier Strike Group and its sailors have, in turn, intercepted dozens of Houthi missiles and drones, shielding numerous commercial ships in their journeys through the Red Sea.
The strike group saw its Red Sea deployment extended twice as the Houthis continued their attacks.
CENTCOM reported that the Eisenhower Carrier Strike Group logged more than 30,000 flight hours and sailed more than 55,000 miles as part of its deployment.
Nevertheless, the Eisenhower Carrier Strike Group’s Red Sea mission had been one of the most intense periods of sea combat for the U.S. Navy since World War II.

title: What Is Hezbollah , the Iranian - backed Group That Could Go to All - out war against Israel ?
message:
BEIRUT (AP) — After more than eight months of low-scale conflict, Israel and the Lebanese militant group Hezbollah are threatening all-out war.
Founded in 1982 during Lebanon’s civil war, Hezbollah’s initial objective was ending Israel’s occupation of southern Lebanon.
Hezbollah and Israel fought a monthlong war that ended in a draw but Israeli bombardment wreaked widespread destruction in southern Lebanon.
Hezbollah's military capabilities have also surged, and it has played a key role in the Syrian civil war, keeping President Bashar al-Assad in power.
Throughout its latest conflict with Israel, Hezbollah has gradually introduced new weapons to its arsenal, especially after Israel began its ground invasion of the southern city of Rafah in Gaza in early May.
event_breakdown: Hezbollah’s military buildup in southern Lebanon has contributed to tensions with Israel, sparking concerns of a renewed conflict between the two sides.

title: Russia says US - made missiles used in deadly Crimea attack
message:
The Russian Foreign Ministry on Monday claimed U.S.-made missiles were used in a deadly weekend attack on Russia-annexed Crimea.
It added U.S.-supplied ATACMS missiles were used in the attack, which reportedly killed four people and injured more than 150 others.
Western-supplied weaponry has been used by Ukrainian forces throughout Kyiv’s war with Russia, which began more than three years ago.
Western allies have previously declared Crimea, which Russia annexed from Ukraine in 2014, is a fair target for Ukraine, the AP noted.
Those killed in Sunday’s attack included two children who were hit by falling debris from Ukrainian missiles shot down near Sevastopol, a port city in Crimea, the AP reported, citing Russian officials.

title: Hezbollah hits Israeli military barracks with drones
message:
Hezbollah hits Israeli military barracks with dronesIRNA - Islamic Republic News AgencyJun 23, 2024Tehran, IRNA -- Lebanon's resistance movement Hezbollah has launched several explosive-laden drones at Israeli military positions in northern occupied territories, wounding a number of Israeli soldiers.
The Israeli media reports said on Sunday that a Hezbollah drone had hit a gathering of Israeli troops in Eilat in northern occupied Palestine.
Hezbollah said several Israeli troops were killed or wounded in the drone strike.
Sunday's drone strikes by Hezbollah came amid fears of a wider conflict between the Israeli regime and the Lebanese resistance movement.
The two sides have been trading fire almost every day since the Israeli regime launched a war of aggression against Gaza more than eight months ago.
event_breakdown: Hezbollah hits Israeli military barracks with drones - The Israeli military barracks in northern occupied Palestine were hit by explosive-laden drones launched by Lebanon's resistance movement Hezbollah on Sunday. Hezbollah said several Israeli soldiers were wounded in the attack.

title: US military leader warns Israel of military offensive in Lebanon – NBC Los Angeles
message:
Israeli officials have threatened a military offensive in Lebanon if there is no negotiated end to push Hezbollah away from the border.
U.S. President Joe Biden’s senior adviser, Amos Hochstein, met with officials in Lebanon and Israel last week in an effort to deescalate tensions.
It is harder to fend off the shorter-range rockets that Hezbollah fires routinely across the border into Israel, he said.
The situation escalated this month after an Israeli airstrike killed a senior Hezbollah military commander in southern Lebanon.
Hezbollah retaliated by firing hundreds of rockets and explosive drones into northern Israel and Israel responded with a heavy assault on the militant group.
event_breakdown: Israeli officials have threatened a military offensive in Lebanon if Hezbollah does not curtail rocket fire.

title: Peace - Loving Hezbollah Storing Huge Cache of Iranian Weapons at Largest Civilian Airport in Lebanon
message:
Hezbollah is storing huge quantities of Iranian weapons, missiles, and explosives in Beirut’s main civilian airport, according to airport whistleblowers.
The cache allegedly includes Iranian-made Falaq unguided artillery rockets, Fateh-110 short-range missiles, road-mobile ballistic missiles and M-600 missiles with ranges of over 150 to 200 miles.
AdvertisementAlso at the airport is the AT-14 Kornet, laser-guided anti-tank guided missiles (ATGM), huge quantities of Burkan short-range ballistic missile and explosive RDX, a toxic white powder also known as cyclonite or hexagon.
The disclosures will raise fears that the Rafic Hariri airport, just four miles from the city centre, could become a major military target.
event_breakdown: Hezbollah storing Iranian weapons, missiles, and explosives in Beirut’s main civilian airport

title: Kremlin issues warning over  barbaric  Crimea attack – CLG News
message:
Kremlin issues warning over 'barbaric' Crimea attack --U.S. involvement in the deadly Ukrainian cluster munition strike on a crowded beach in Russia's Sevastopol will have consequences, Dmitry Peskov has said | 24 June 2024 | Moscow "understands perfectly well" who is behind Sunday's deadly strike on the city of Sevastopol in Russia's Crimea, Kremlin spokesperson Dmitry Peskov has said, vowing Russian retaliation.
The Ukrainian attack carried out with U.S.-supplied ATACMS missiles killed at least four people, among them two children, and injured more than 150, according to local officials.
"We see...an absolutely barbaric missile attack in Crimea.
We understand perfectly well who is behind this...who is aiming these absolutely technically complex missiles at the targets," Peskov told reporters during a press briefing on Monday.
Just ask them this question," Peskov told the journalists in attendance.
event_breakdown: U.S. involvement in the deadly Ukrainian cluster munition strike on a crowded beach in Russia's Sevastopol will have consequences, Dmitry Peskov has said.

title: Russia , Ukraine conduct airstrikes on multiple cities as war intensifies
message:
Russia, Ukraine conduct airstrikes on multiple cities as war intensifiesIran Press TVSunday, 23 June 2024 3:26 PMRussia and Ukraine have conducted air attacks on multiple cities as the conflict between the neighboring countries intensifies.
Elsewhere on Sunday, at least 30 drones were destroyed over Russia's western region of Bryansk, which borders Ukraine, Governor Alexander Bogomaz said on Telegram.
Russian air defenses have shot down an unspecified number of unmanned aerial vehicles above the Western Russian region of Smolensk, Governor Vasily Anokhin wrote on Telegram.
"Air defenses responded to an attack of Ukrainian drones over Smolensk and Yartsevo," he said in a statement.
Kiev forces also hit Russian aerial drone facilities in the southern region of Krasnodar, the Ukrainian navy reported on Telegram.

title: Russian Strike in East Ukraine Kills 5 , Wounds Dozens
message:
Russian strikes on the eastern Ukrainian city of Pokrovsk killed five people and wounded dozens more on Monday, the governor of the Donetsk region said.
Over recent weeks, Moscow has concentrated its firepower on the eastern industrial region of Donetsk, which the Kremlin claims is part of Russia.
Russian forces have been advancing towards Pokrovsk over recent months, since they captured the fortress town of Avdiivka in February.
Filashkin said separately that a 62-year-old man had been killed in a Russian attack on the town of Kurakhove, south of Pokrovsk.
Russia claimed to have annexed Donetsk in late 2022, along with three other regions of Ukraine it had partially occupied.

The health ministry said the killing of Hani al-Jaafarawi brought the number of medical staff killed by Israeli fire since Oct 7 to 500.
Mourners attend the funeral of Palestinian Hani Al-Jaafarwi, the director of ambulance and emergency services at the ministry of health, who was killed in an Israeli strike on Al-Daraj clinic, in Gaza City.
The Israeli offensive in retaliation has killed almost 37,600 people, according to Palestinian health authorities, and has left Gaza in ruins.

title: Crimean beachgoers struck by deadly shrapnel shower from missile
message:
Moscow: Russia has blamed the United States for a Ukrainian attack on the Russian-annexed Crimean peninsula after missile fragments fell on beachgoers in an incident that killed four people, including two children, and injured 151 more.
The Russian Defence Ministry said four of the US-delivered Army Tactical Missile System (ATACMS) missiles, equipped with cluster warheads, were shot down by air defence systems and the ammunition of a fifth had detonated in mid-air.

title: With another setback for cease - fire talks , worries of full - scale war for Israel and Lebanon escalate
message:
Israel and Hezbollah each have lessons from their last war, in 2006, a monthlong conflict that ended in a draw.
A United Nations resolution ending the war called for withdrawal of Israeli forces from Lebanon and a demilitarized zone on Lebanon’s side of the border.
Iran-backed Hezbollah initially seemed caught off-guard by Hamas’ Oct. 7 attack on Israel, a regional ally, but began firing rockets into northern Israel the following day.
In a war with Hezbollah, there would be no point in additional evacuations since the militia’s rockets and missiles can reach all of Israel.
A full-scale war would likely spread to multiple fronts, escalating the involvement of Iranian proxies in Syria, Iraq and Yemen — and perhaps draw in Iran itself.

The 2006 war began when Hezbollah militants abducted Israeli soldiers in a cross-border raid. A United Nations resolution that called for the sides to withdraw laid the groundwork for a cease-fire. Hezbollah and Israel have each gained insights into how to wage war and protect its forces since then.

title: Aerial Drone Launched By Yemen Houthi Rebels Hits Ship In The Red Sea , Causing Damage And Injuries – The Yeshiva World
message:
An aerial drone launched by Yemen’s Houthi rebels struck and damaged a vessel in the Red Sea on Sunday, officials said, the latest attack by the group targeting shipping in the vital maritime corridor.
The drone attack happened around dawn off the coast of the rebel-held port city of Hodeida, the British military’s United Kingdom Maritime Trade Operations center said.
Hours after the attack, Houthi military spokesman Brig.
Gen. Yahya Saree claimed the attack, saying the rebels targeted the Transworld Navigator.
Saree claimed without offering evidence the rebels instead used a drone boat in the attack, something contradicted by every other report on the assault.
event_breakdown: Houthi rebels, armed group active in Yemen, attacked a warship Sunday in the Red Sea originating from Hodeida, located along the coast of Yemen. The attack was reported to be in the form of a drone that disrupted shipping traffic.

title: Bartlesville Man Arrested , Accused Of Murder In Missouri
message:
A 32-year-old Bartlesville man was arrested and accused of a fatal stabbing in Missouri by authorities.
By: News On 6A 32-year-old Bartlesville man was arrested and accused of a fatal stabbing in Missouri by authorities.
The McDonald County Sheriff's Office said Garrett Sumter is facing second-degree murder charges for a stabbing on Saturday.
Authorities searched for him and he was arrested without incident by a State Trooper, MCSO said.
No other details on what led to the stabbing have been unveiled.
event_breakdown:
McGregor, Missouri, police said officers arrived to the scene in the 400 block of South River Street around 1:20 a.m. Friday and found a 21-year-old man who had been shot outside of a residence.
The man was taken to the hospital for treatment.
No one else was injured, police said, and the motive is unknown.
Police said the victim and the alleged shooter have a history, and the shooting was connected to an incident at Creekbend Tavern where the two worked together last summer.

BEIRUT (AP) — After more than eight months of low-scale conflict, Israel and the Lebanese militant group Hezbollah are threatening all-out war.
Founded in 1982 during Lebanon’s civil war, Hezbollah’s initial objective was ending Israel’s occupation of southern Lebanon.
Hezbollah and Israel fought a monthlong war that ended in a draw but Israeli bombardment wreaked widespread destruction in southern Lebanon.
Hezbollah’s military capabilities have also surged, and it has played a key role in the Syrian civil war, keeping President Bashar al-Assad in power.
Throughout its latest conflict with Israel, Hezbollah has gradually introduced new weapons to its arsenal, especially after Israel began its ground invasion of the southern city of Rafah in Gaza in early May.

title: With another setback for cease - fire talks , worries of full - scale war for Israel and Lebanon escalate
message:
With another setback for cease-fire talks, worries of full-scale war for Israel and Lebanon escalateBEIRUT (AP) — The prospect of a full-scale war between Israel and Lebanon’s Hezbollah militant group terrifies people on both sides of the border, but some see it as an inevitable fallout from Israel’s ongoing war against Hamas in Gaza, particularly as cease-fire negotiations have faltered.
Israel and Hezbollah each have lessons from their last war, in 2006, a monthlong conflict that ended in a draw.
The 2006 war, six years after Israeli forces that had occupied southern Lebanon withdrew, erupted after Hezbollah captured two Israeli soldiers and killed several others in a cross-border raid.
A United Nations resolution ending the war called for withdrawal of Israeli forces from Lebanon and a demilitarized zone on Lebanon’s side of the border.
In a war with Hezbollah, there would be no point in additional evacuations since the militia’s rockets and missiles can reach all of Israel.

title: US says Blinken will emphasize to Israel Gallant the need for post - war Gaza plan
message:
By Simon Lewis and Humeyra PamukWASHINGTON (Reuters) -U.S. Secretary of State Antony Blinken on Monday pressed Israeli Defense Minister Yoav Gallant on the need for Israel to swiftly develop a robust post-war plan for Gaza and ensure the tensions with Hezbollah on Israel's northern border do not escalate further.
"He (Blinken) updated Minister Gallant on ongoing diplomatic efforts to advance security, governance, and reconstruction in Gaza during a post-conflict period and emphasized the importance of that work to Israel’s security," a State Department statement following the meeting said.
Palestinians have previously said only an end to Israeli occupation and the creation of a Palestinian state will bring peace.
The Israeli minister described his meetings in Washington, including the one with Blinken, as "critical", according to comments released by his office.
The Israeli offensive in retaliation has killed almost 37,600 people, according to Palestinian health authorities, and has left Gaza in ruins.
event_breakdown: Israeli Defense Ministry approves $3.8 billion for the IDF's multi-year plan to add significant capabilities to Israel's military might- The ministry noted that the purchase of two new F-35 fighter jets would increase the number of stealth jets in the Air Force to 72.

title: Hama key weapons operative Muhammad Salah eliminated in Israeli airstrike
message:
Israel eliminated terrorist Muhammad Salah, who was responsible for projects and development in Hamas' Weapons Manufacturing Headquarters, the Israel Defence Forces said on Monday.
Salah was part of a project to develop strategic weaponry for the Hamas terrorist organisation, and he commanded a number of Hamas terrorist squads that worked on developing weapons, according to IDF.
IDF also dismantled the launchers that were being used to fire at IDF troops during the war in the Tel al-Sultan area in Gaza.
IDF troops are continuing their operational activity in central Gaza.
They have identified several terrorists who were operating in the area and eliminated them in a drone strike.
event_breakdown: IDF troops are continuing their operational activity in central Gaza. They have identified several terrorists who were operating in the area and eliminated them in a drone strike.

title: Change in wind direction prompts worry about more North Korean trash balloon launches toward South – Metro US
message:
In this photo provided by Fighters For A Free North Korea, North Korean defector Park Sang-hak, left, and a member of Fighters For A Free North Korea hold balloons bearing anti-North Korean propaganda leaflets in Paju, near the border with North Korea, South Korea, Thursday, June 20, 2024.
SEOUL, South Korea (AP) — North Korea resumed launches of balloons likely carrying trash toward South Korea on Monday night, South Korea’s military said, in the latest round of a Cold War-style campaign on the Korean Peninsula.
The statement asked South Korean citizens not to touch North Korean balloons and report them to military and police authorities.
North Korea has reacted to past South Korean loudspeaker broadcasts and civilian balloon activities by firing rounds across the border, prompting South Korea to return fire, according to South Korea.
The trash also included jeans, a banned item in North Korea; South Korean clothes that were badly damaged, likely by knives or scissors; and other items with imitation Disney characters.
event_breakdown: Balloons likely carrying trash from North Korea were found at multiple South Korean locations along the border. The military asked people not to touch them and report them.

title: Ukraine Zelenskyy replaces commander of joint forces | World News
message:
President Volodymyr Zelenskyy said on Monday he had replaced the commander of the Joint Forces of Ukraine's Armed Forces, Lieutenant-General Yuri Sodol, after reports surfaced that he had performed badly in the 28-month-old war against Russia.
Zelenskyy, speaking in his nightly video address, gave no reason for the dismissal.
In the spring of 2023 he commanded the defence of Bakhmut in eastern Ukraine, a town that eventually fell to Russian forces after many months of pitched battles.
With Russian forces making gains and slowly advancing through eastern Ukraine in recent months, the military has undergone considerable changes.
The military top commander, Valeriy Zaluzhnyi, was dismissed in February after public differences with Zelenskyy over the conduct of the war.
event_breakdown: President Volodymyr Zelenskyy fires commander Joint Forces of Ukraine's Armed Forces

title: CRPF Jawan From Kerala Among 2 Killed In Naxal Attack In Chhattisgarh
message:
(MENAFN- AsiaNet News) Two Central Reserve Force (CRPF) personnel, one of whom was a Malayali, were killed on Sunday in Chhattisgarh's Sukma district when Naxalites detonated a truck using an improvised explosive device (IED).
The deceased Keralite, Vishnu R, 35, hailed from Palode in Thiruvananthapuram.
The security personnel were traveling in a truck and on motorcycles.
Naxalites triggered an IED blast targeting the truck, which resulted in the deaths of constable Shailendra (29) and the driver, Vishnu R (35).
The late Vishnu was the son of Raghuvar and Ajitha, residing at Anizham House, Palode Farm Junction.
event_breakdown: Central reserve police force personnel killed by Naxalite in Sukma district, Chhattisgarh. Security personnel were traveling in a truck. The deceased personnel were: Vishnu R, a CRPF constable and Malayali from Thiruvananthapuram district, Shailendra, 29, and driver of the CRPF vehicle.

message:
South Korean Joint Chiefs of Staff spokesperson Lee Sung Joon told reporters Monday that the military is closely monitoring North Korean moves because northerly or northwesterly winds, favorable for North Korean balloon launches, were forecast on Monday.
North Korea said its balloon campaign was a tit-for-tat action against South Korean activists who flew political leaflets critical of its leadership across the border.
A balloon believed to have been sent by North Korea, carrying various objects including what appeared to be trash, is pictured in Incheon, South Korea.
The South Korean military didn't say how it would respond if North Korea conducts a new round of balloon launches.
North Korea has reacted to past South Korean loudspeaker broadcasts and civilian balloon activities by firing rounds across the border, prompting South Korea to return fire, according to South Korea.

title: Likely Yemen Houthi rebel attack targets ship in Gulf of Aden as Eisenhower reportedly heads home
message:
A commercial ship traveling through the Gulf of Aden saw explosions near the vessel, authorities said Saturday, likely the latest attack by Yemen's Houthi rebels attempting to target the shipping lane.
Meanwhile, U.S. officials reportedly ordered the USS Dwight D. Eisenhower, the aircraft carrier leading America's response to the Houthi attacks, to return home.
The captain of the ship targeted late Friday saw "explosions in the vicinity of the vessel," the British military's United Kingdom Maritime Trade Operations center said.
The report said an aircraft carrier operating in the Pacific would be taking the Eisenhower's place.
The closest American aircraft carrier known to be operating in Asia is the USS Theodore Roosevelt.

message:

Response measures will definitely follow," the Russian Foreign Ministry underscored.

Four people, including two children, were killed in the attack, with over 150 others being injured, Sevastopol Governor Mikhail Razvozhayev said.
June 24 was designated as a day of mourning in Sevastopol and Crimea.

message:
North Korea has flown balloons carrying trash since late May, with hundreds landing in South Korea.
South Korea deployed military explosives units and chemical and biological warfare teams to inspect the objects.
North Korea has said the balloons were retaliation for a propaganda campaign by North Korean defectors and activists in the South who regularly send over balloons carrying food, medicine, money and leaflets criticising the North's leaders.
North Korea, which suffers a chronic food shortage, depended on South Korea for massive shipments of chemical fertilizer until such aid was suspended in 2007 as Pyongyang accelerated weapons development.
Last week, the North warned it would send more balloons carrying trash.

title: Naxal attack in Chhattisgarh : 2 CRPF jawans killed in IED blast in Sukma district – Indian Defence Research Wing
message:
Naxal attack in Chhattisgarh: 2 CRPF jawans killed in IED blast in Sukma district| BySOURCE: ANITwo jawans of the Central Reserve Police Force (CRPF) were killed on Sunday in an IED blast planted by Naxalites between Silger and Tekulagudem, under the limits of Jagargunda Police Station in the Sukma district of Chhattisgarh.
The killed security personnel were identified as Vishnu R (35), hailing from Thiruvananthapuram, Kerala while the other jawan was identified as Shailendra (29) who hailed from Kanpur, Uttar Pradesh.
The security personnel were part of the Commando Battalion for Resolute Action (CoBRA) 201 battalion.
The IED was planted by Naxalites on the way from Camp Silger to Tekalgudem to cause harm to the security forces.
The four Naxals killed included a zonal commander, a sub-zonal commander as well as an area commander.

CRPF jawans killed in IED blast in Sukma, Chhattisgarh

title: Gunmen kill six police officers as church and synagogue attacked in Russia Dagestan
message:
Twenty people were confirmed dead on Monday in Russia’s mainly Muslim region of Dagestan after gunmen went on the rampage in coordinated attacks in two of the republic’s most important cities.
Russia’s state media cited law enforcement as saying two sons of Magomed Omarov, the head of central Dagestan’s Sergokala district, were among the attackers in Dagestan.
They were killed and their father was detained, state media said.
On Monday security forces cordoned off roads with armoured vehicles during a counter-terror operation against the gunmen.
The terror threat was officially declared over after officials said six of the gunmen were killed in shootouts in Makhachkala and Derbent, two major cities in the mainly Muslim region on the Caspian Sea.

title: Troy Nehls ineligible for military badge , Army confirms
message:
Troy Nehls (R-TX) has not qualified for the military pin that he proudly wears on his suit jacket despite repeatedly claiming the Army was mistaken for rescinding the badge, according to the congressman’s service record.
Nehls has received backlash from some other House members for wearing a Combat Infantryman Badge despite an investigation from CBS News that found the pin was revoked from his military record in 2023.
Nehls has repeatedly claimed the Army “got it wrong” and that he did qualify for the distinction — but the Army confirmed to NOTUS that he was not eligible.
Nehls was given the award after serving as a civil affairs officer in Afghanistan with the 101st Airborne Division in 2008, which later awarded him the infantryman badge.
A Combat Infantryman Badge is only awarded to infantrymen or Special Forces soldiers engaged in active ground combat.
event_breakdown: The Combat Infantryman Badge is not awarded to Civil Affairs officers.

title: EU adopts 14th package of sanctions against Russia
message:
The EU adopted a 14th package of sanctions against Russia.
The package contains important new energy-related measures targeting liquified natural gas (LNG), and measures targeting vessels which support Russia’s war.
As regards LNG, the package prohibits all future investments in, and exports to, LNG projects under construction in Russia.
Moreover, the package prohibits the import of Russian LNG into specific terminals which are not connected to the EU gas pipeline network.
The package also finetunes the import ban on Russian diamonds already agreed in the 12th sanctions package.
location: The EU adopted the 14th package of sanctions against Russia.
event_breakdown: The EU adopted a 14th package of sanctions against Russia includes important new energy-related measures targeting LNG and vessels which support Russia’s war. the package prohibit all future investments in, and exports to, LNG projects under construction in Russia. Moreover, the package prohibit the import of Russian LNG into specific terminals which are not connected to the EU gas pipeline network. The package also further finetunes the import ban on Russian diamonds already agreed in the 12th sanctions package.

title: New Age | Israel continues to bomb Gaza targets
message:
Israeli forces kept bombing targets on Monday across the besieged Gaza Strip, including in the Nuseirat and Rafah areas, witnesses said, while gun battles were reported in Zeitun.
The Israeli military said troops in the Rafah area had ‘eliminated a number of armed terrorists’, dismantled tunnel shafts and found ‘large amounts of weapons’.
The Israeli military said its jets struck militants who had ‘operated from within buildings that previously served as an UNRWA headquarters’.
Israel has faced a global outcry over the surging civilian death toll, the punishing siege and the large-scale destruction in Gaza, and tensions have also grown between Netanyahu and Biden.
The militants also seized hostages, 116 of whom remain in Gaza although the army says 41 are dead.

Israeli military jets target Gaza militants using buildings previously invaded by militants, report Israeli army. title: Milrem Robotics Unveils Artificial Intelligence - Guided Tactical Unmanned Ground Vehicle
message:
In a world where technological innovation is the driving force behind military advancements, Estonian company Milrem Robotics has stepped into the spotlight by introducing a cutting-edge AI-guided tactical unmanned ground vehicle (UGV).
Milrem Robotics and Leonardo CollaborationThe collaboration between Milrem Robotics and Leonardo represents a significant milestone in the field of robotic combat systems.
Milrem Robotics and Loc Performance CollaborationIn addition to their collaboration with Leonardo, Milrem Robotics has previously ventured into the US Army’s quest for advanced robotic combat vehicles (RCV).
Announced in June 2023, Milrem Robotics partnered with Michigan robotics firm Loc Performance to develop a “groundbreaking” Robotic Combat Vehicle – Light (RCV-L) for the US Army’s competition.
By participating in this consortium, Milrem Robotics is actively contributing to developing methods that will shape the future of manned and unmanned military operations.

title: Bangkok Post - A miraculous escape
message:
More than 200 Thai students were studying in the Philippines when the Pacific War broke out on Dec 8, 1941.
Prof Francis Bowes Sayre, the US High Commissioner to the Philippines, a close friend of Siam, played a role in making sure Thai students would not be interned.
Pacha Osathanond, the assistant to the American superintendent of the Thai students, was having lunch when he saw these bomber formations over Manila.
The Thai students witnessed Imperial Japanese Army soldiers, riding bicycles, capture Manila on Jan 2, 1942.
The Aden Maru returned to Manila before the ship left for Saigon with only the Thai students on board.

title: Iraqi Pro - Iran Fighter Killed In Strike On Eastern Syria
message:

"An Iraqi member in the Islamic Resistance in Iraq was killed, and two others were in a preliminary toll, as a result of an unknown air strike," the observatory said, referring to a loose alliance of Iran-backed groups.

title: Putin preys on Biden escalation fears after Crimea strike
message:
On Sunday, at least four Russian civilians were killed when a beach in Sevastopol, the largest city in Russian-occupied Crimea, was struck by explosives of yet-to-be confirmed origin.

The DPAA announced today that the remains of a soldier from World War II have been identified. The soldier, Private First Class James P. Murphy, was assigned to the Company I, 31st Infantry Regiment in 1942. His remains were interred as Unknowns at the Manila American Cemetery and Memorial (MACM).
Murphy's remains were identified using a combination of dental and anthropological analysis, as well as circumstantial evidence. He will be buried in Bogalusa, Louisiana, on August 3, 2024.

title: Japanese mother and child stabbed in China in front of school bus
message:
By Himari Semans and Nectar Gan, CNNTokyo/Hong Kong (CNN) — A Japanese woman and her child were among three people stabbed by a man on Monday in front of a school bus at a bus stop in eastern China, according to Japanese authorities.
In Suzhou, the attack took place Monday afternoon as the mother waited to pick up her child at a bus stop near a Japanese school, according to the Japanese official.
The school bus is from the Suzhou Japanese School, located less than a mile from the bus stop in an area where many Japanese nationals live, NHK said.
Opened in 2005, the Suzhou Japanese School offers six-year elementary school and three-year junior high school curriculums, according to its website.
Its rules state that students must be picked up by a parent or guardian from the school bus.

title: Polish MP calls for withdrawal from ban on anti - personnel mines
message:
(MENAFN) Mariusz Blaszczak, a member of Poland's parliament representing the Law and Justice (PiS) party and former defense minister, has called for Poland to withdraw from the Ottawa Convention banning anti-personnel mines.
Speaking at a PiS press conference, Blaszczak proposed deploying these mines along Poland's border with the Kaliningrad Region, a Russian enclave situated between Poland and Lithuania.
Tusk publicly rejected the idea of mining the borders with Russia and Belarus, reaffirming Poland's commitment to the Ottawa Convention, which prohibits the use, production, stockpiling, and proliferation of anti-personnel landmines.
Despite political transitions, Poland's current government has continued this military presence strategy.
The debate over deploying landmines along Poland's eastern borders underscores broader geopolitical tensions and differing perspectives on national security measures within Poland's political landscape.

title: US Army new precision missile hit moving target in Pacific exercise
message:
The U.S. Army said it fired its newly fielded Precision Strike Missile from the Pacific island of Palau and engaged a moving target at sea, marking the first time the weapon has been used outside of American-based testing sites.
The first set of Precision Strike Missiles, or PrSM, were delivered to the Army in December 2023 to begin replacing the legacy Army Tactical Missile System.
Hitting a moving target at sea from land is extremely challenging.
Lockheed and an RTX and Northrop Grumman team will compete for a subsequent phase of the PrSM program.
America’s 2019 withdrawal from the Intermediate-Range Nuclear Forces Treaty with Russia has allowed the U.S. Army to develop the missile to fly farther.

title: What is Hezbollah , the Iranian - backed group that could go to all - out war against Israel ?
message:
By KAREEM CHEHAYEB The Associated PressBEIRUT (AP) — After more than eight months of low-scale conflict, Israel and the Lebanese militant group Hezbollah are threatening all-out war.
Founded in 1982 during Lebanon’s civil war, Hezbollah’s initial objective was ending Israel’s occupation of southern Lebanon.
Hezbollah and Israel fought a monthlong war that ended in a draw but Israeli bombardment wreaked widespread destruction in southern Lebanon.
Hezbollah’s military capabilities have also surged, and it has played a key role in the Syrian civil war, keeping President Bashar al-Assad in power.
Throughout its latest conflict with Israel, Hezbollah has gradually introduced new weapons to its arsenal, especially after Israel began its ground invasion of the southern city of Rafah in Gaza in early May.

- Recent conflicts have been fought in both Gaza and Syria.
- Hezbollah's dominance has made the organization a key player in the politics of Syria.
- Israel's bombing of Gaza has also made it a target of the group.
- The tensions between the two sides have also strained relations between the US and Iran.

title: VBPD : Woman charged in connection with stabbing on Northampton Blvd .
message:
VBPD: Woman charged in connection with stabbing on Northampton Blvd.
VIRGINIA BEACH, Va. (WAVY) – A 48-year-old woman was arrested Monday night in connection with a stabbing on Northampton Boulevard.
Salina Frazier-Adams (Courtesy: VBPD)According to officials, around 8:50 p.m., officers were dispatched to the 5800 block of Northampton Boulevard for reports of a stabbing.
48-year-old Salina Frazier-Adams was arrested and charged with felony malicious wounding in connection with the incident.
For the latest news, weather, sports, and streaming video, head to WAVY.com.
event_breakdown:
VIRGINIA BEACH, Va. (WAVY) – A woman was arrested Monday night in connection with a stabbing on Northampton Boulevard.

Newport News police said around 8:50 p.m., officers responded to the 5800 block of Northampton Boulevard for reports of a stabbing. When officers arrived, they found a 19-year-old victim suffering from a non-life-threatening stab wound. Officers said the suspect left the scene before police arrived.

Police found 48-year-old Salina Frazier-Adams at the restaurant that owns the lot where the incident was reported. Frazier-Adams was arrested and charged with felony malicious wounding in connection with Monday's stabbing, according to police.

No other details have been released at this time. The investigation is ongoing.

title: Subway attacker sentenced to 22 years in prison for attempted murder of commuter in unprovoked attack in Howard Beach : DA – QNS
message:
Queens District Attorney Melinda Katz announced that Waheed Foster was sentenced to 22 years in prison for the attempted murder of a 33-year-old woman inside a Howard Beach subway station in September 2022.
Sign up for our QNS email newsletter to get news, updates, and local insights delivered straight to your inbox!
A homeless man who viciously beat a 33-year-old woman in an unprovoked attack inside a Howard Beach subway station in September 2022 was sentenced to 22 years in prison on Monday in Queens Supreme Court.
Waheed Foster, 43, pleaded guilty to attempted murder in the second degree on June 6, for the random attack that shocked the city.
Foster was on parole for attacking workers at the Creedmoor Psychiatric Center at the time of the attack on Gomes.

message:

U.S. Secretary of State Antony Blinken on Monday warned Israeli Defense Minister Yoav Gallant against allowing the conflict with Hamas in Gaza to expand to include Lebanon and Hezbollah.

title: Russia promises retaliation against US for Ukraine strike on Crimea | World News
message:
The Kremlin on Monday squarely blamed the United States for an attack on Crimea with US-supplied ATACMS missiles that killed at least four people and injured 151, and Moscow formally warned the US ambassador that retaliation would follow.
But directly blaming the United States for an attack on Crimea - which Russia unilaterally annexed in 2014 although most of the world considers it part of Ukraine - is a step further.
Russia said the United States had supplied the weapons, while the US military had aimed them and provided data.
After the United States allowed Ukraine to direct some US weapons into Russia, the Kremlin sent signals that it viewed this as a serious escalation.
"Of course, the involvement of the United States in the fighting, as a result of which peaceful Russians are dying, cannot but have consequences," Peskov said.

title: Marines make first landing on renovated WWII airfield in the Pacific
message:
The Marines recently landed their first fixed wing aircraft on a recertified airfield on the Pacific island of Peleliu, which jarheads captured after brutal combat in 1944.
The Marine Corps Engineer Detachment Palau, MCED-P 24.1, contains engineers from the 7th Engineer Support Battalion, 1st Marine Logistics Group.
The detachment spent the past few months rehabilitating the airfield to accommodate large, fixed-wing aircraft such as the KC-130J.
Brandon Gonzalez, a combat engineer squad leader who led vegetation removal and assisted with unexploded ordnance sweeping.
“Today is a historic moment as we land a Marine Corps aircraft on the ‘Sledge’ runway,” remarked Maj. Christopher Romero, Marine Corps Engineer Detachment Palau commanding officer.

title: Decades after war , North Korea still builds borders , draws warning shots
message:
By Hyonhee ShinSEOUL (Reuters) -Seventy-four years after the Korean War began, North Korean troops are building new fortifications, occasionally inviting warning shots from South Korean counterparts across a border that has been frozen in a state of war.
The moves resulted in rare run-ins with South Korean troops when they fired warning shots, and some North Koreans were even killed by their own landmines as they pushed closer to the demarcation line, South Korean officials have said.
Tuesday marks 74 years since the beginning of the war, when North Korea's military stormed over the border into the U.S.-backed South.
North Korea was sending more balloons apparently carrying trash to South Korea on Tuesday, according to South Korea's military.
"North Korea is advancing its nuclear and missile capabilities and professing the possibility of using nuclear weapons first," he said aboard the carrier.

title: Poland Rolls Out  Holidays with the Army  in a Recruitment Drive with Russia in Mind
message:
They have signed up for a new summer program, “Holidays with the Army,” which offers basic military training for thousands of Poles aged 18 to 35.
The military introduced the program in a search for recruits as Poland expands its 198,000-member army in the face of renewed Russian aggression in the region, including neighboring Ukraine.
There has been great interest in the program, which is taking place at 70 locations across Poland, officials say.
But young Poles, like those of their generation along NATO's entire eastern front, fear they can no longer take that peace for granted.
Along Poland's northern border is the Russian territory of Kaliningrad, where Poland believes Moscow stores about 100 tactical nuclear warheads.

The goal of the program is to expand their 198,000-member army in the face of renewed Russian aggression in the region, including neighboring Ukraine.

title: Lithuanian conscription : fortifying NATO flank ? – DW – 06 / 25 / 2024
message:
Lithuania's parliament has extended the terms for compulsory military service.
On June 13, the Seimas, Lithuania's parliament, reformed compulsory military service regulations.
In 2008, four years after joining NATO, Lithuania had suspended compulsory military service and had transitioned to keeping a professional army.
"Now, everything has changed, as the decision on compulsory military service has shown," the retired colonel added.
Malinionis believes that shifts like these could drastically reduce the rate of conscripts being exempted from military service.

target event: Seeking to press its advantages in troop numbers and weaponry before Ukrainian forces are bulked up by promised new Western military aid that is already trickling to the front line.
2. It dashes to positions and without delay fires a Soviet-era Pion self-propelled howitzer at Russian positions before it can be targeted itself.
3. Meantime, it said, “Russian forces are attempting to make tactically and operationally significant gains” before it arrives.
4. Russia has pounded Kharkiv in recent months, apparently to draw some Ukrainian forces away from the defense of Donetsk while trying to create a buffer zone to prevent cross-border Ukrainian attacks.

title: UN World Food Program decries looting and burning of its warehouse in western Myanmar combat zone
message:
The Arakan Army blamed the attack on army soldiers and local Muslims said to be fighting alongside them.
In May, the Arakan Army took over another Rakhine city, which like Maungdaw has a majority Rohingya population.
At the time, the military government and the Arakan Army each blamed the other for burning down most of the city and forcing its residents to leave.
Ethnic Rakhine nationalist supporters of the Arakan Army were then among the persecutors of the Rohingya minority.
The Arakan Army now claims it is not prejudiced against the Rohingya, and provides them with humanitarian aid.
location: The main event is the burning of the Rakhine city of Maungdaw.
event_breakdown: Target event not found

title: Marshals task force in April Charlotte shootout wasnt using body cameras , lawyer says
message:
That task force includes Charlotte-Mecklenburg Police Department officers, state corrections officers and other local agencies.
Presumably, that means no member of the marshals fugitive task force was using a body camera.
CMPD confirmed officers serving on task forces follow CMPD’s body worn camera policy, but said the sergeant on the task force didn’t violate CMPD body camera policy.
Marshals task forces dispersed throughout the country arrested nearly 73,000 suspects last year, according to the Marshals Service.
Task force officers with body cameras have to wear and activate them when arresting fugitives, an interim policy says.
event_breakdown: New U.S. Marshals task force procedure requires using body cameras when arresting fugitives.
